intro: Hariota crenata, commonly known as the serrated hariota, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite, with a serrated edge, giving it its common name. Hariota crenata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
